title: Portland, Oregon Zoo
name: Portland, Oregon Zoo
description:
A Map by Micropopetah

kids, kid-friendly, kid friendly, kidfriendly, animals, zoo, giraffe, elephant, chimpanzee, polar bear, sun bear, sea lion, anaconda, train, summer fun, outdoors, snacks, concession stand, free concerts, zebra, hippo, starfish, goat, petting zoo

properties.description: Posted by Schomer

properties.name: Giraffes have Dexterous Tongues
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingWe watched the stork and the giraffes for a long time. There were also some adorable hooved creatures here, maybe gazelles. We put a quarter into the tourist telescope and studied the feathers of the stork. It was definitely worth the 25 cents. The giraffes are beautiful. We watched them eating leaves off the trees for a long time.

properties.name: Homemade Waffle Cones
properties.description: Posted by MicropopetahWe got lunch at the Bear Walk Cafe. We had pizza and ice cream. I had a homemade waffle cone! homemade waffle cones! on Vimeo

properties.name: Humbolt Penguins
properties.description: Posted by MicropopetahOur first stop was at the Penguins. After having seen the penguins at the New England Aquarium, we weren\'t so impressed with the Oregon Zoo exhibit. We looked at all the peripheral stuff, like comparing a penguin skeleton to that of a flying bird.

properties.name: Orangatans
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingAbove this exhibit, there are three signs describing the personalities of the three apes who live in it. This was one of the zoo\'s most depressing corners.

properties.name: Pet the Pygmy Goats
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing I was surprised that Vigo wanted to go into this exhibit. He is often pretty shy of animals. He had been around goats one time before, at an Easter event at a goat farm in North Carolina. I think he remembered that and knew that the goats would be safe.

properties.name: The Hippos Were Sleeping
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingWe sat in the shelter next to the hippo exhibit and watched them sleep for a while. It was a hot day and a lot of the animals were asleep.

properties.name: Train Station from Washinton Park to the Oregon Zoo
properties.description: Posted by Micropopetah It was pretty exciting taking the little train to the zoo. It was kind of pricey, but it\'s the sort of thing you spring for once in a while when you\'re on vacation. They have three trains which run every 15 minutes until about 5:30. You can either go all around in a loop, or do like we did and take half the loop to the zoo, then the other half later to get back to the park. The train ride is really only interesting as a train ride. You can\'t really see animals. It\'s not like a safari train or anything. You drive through an area where they keep machinery and old train parts. You drive behind the elephant exhibit. The nicest part of the ride is through the woods. There\'s a beautiful, steep ravine off one side of the train. You go through a little tunnel when the train pulls into the zoo. That\'s a nice touch.

properties.name: Tunnel Before Zoo Stop
properties.description: Posted by Micropopetah

properties.name: Very Scary Anaconda
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingNot that there are other kinds of anacondas than "very scary." This exhibit is pretty neat. It has a sort of half-tank, half mangrove, so you can see underwater and above. In one part of the exhibit, an anaconda sits twisted around a root with only its nose sticking out above the water, waiting for some hapless monkey to come get a drink of water. Yikes. I don\'t think the snake moves much ever. I wonder what the passage of time is like to an anaconda. The exhibit also has a lot of fish in it, and one small member of the crocodile family. At the far end there is a section with a few monkeys in it, but I think they and the anaconda are in separated exhibits.

properties.name: We Stumbled onto the Zoo
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  4001 Southwest Canyon Road, Portland, OR, 97221We didn\'t really have any plans. I just wanted to drive up the hill behind Jason and Di-Ann\'s neighborhood to see if we could find a nice view. I didn\'t even know that the zoo was up there. As I went up the hill, I saw signs for Washington Park and decided to follow them, then I saw signs for the zoo. As we entered Washinton Park near the Rose Garden, I saw the sign for the zoo train and decided that wandering around the zoo would be a great thing to do for the afternoon. We got really lucky with a free parking spot on Sherwood, right next to the Rose Test Garden and the Zoo Train Station. We walked over to the Rose Garden concession stand for a bottle of water and an apple, then we walked up to the train station. We ended up having a great day at the zoo, even though we hadn\'t planned on going anywhere in particular. At the end of our visit we ran into Di-Ann and Emiko and Tabor. Great minds think alike!

properties.name: Zebras
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing
